segment.source: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: With , you can enable BYOD ("bring your own device") iOS and Mac OS X device enrollment to give access to company email and apps to iPhone, iPad and Mac users.
segment.target: With , you can enable BYOD ("bring your own device") iOS and Mac OS X device enrollment to give access to company email and apps to iPhone, iPad and Mac users.

segment.source: Once users install the company portal app, their devices can be targeted with policy using the administration console.
segment.target: Once users install the company portal app, their devices can be targeted with policy using the administration console.

segment.source: Before you can manage iOS and Mac devices, you must import an Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate from Apple.
segment.target: Before you can manage iOS and Mac devices, you must import an Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate from Apple.

segment.source: This certificate allows Intune to manage iOS and Mac devices and establishes an accredited and encrypted IP connection with the mobile device management authority services.
segment.target: This certificate allows Intune to manage iOS and Mac devices and establishes an accredited and encrypted IP connection with the mobile device management authority services.

segment.source: As an alternative to enrollment with the Company Portal app, you can also enroll corporate-owned iOS devices .
segment.target: As an alternative to enrollment with the Company Portal app, you can also enroll corporate-owned iOS devices .

segment.source: Prepare to manage iOS and Mac devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Prepare to manage iOS and Mac devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: The following steps allow to manage iOS devices using the Company Portal.
segment.target: The following steps allow to manage iOS devices using the Company Portal.

segment.source: Set up iOS and Mac enrollment with Intune
segment.target: Set up iOS and Mac enrollment with Intune

segment.source: Set up Intune
segment.target: Set up Intune

segment.source: If you haven’t already, prepare for mobile device management by setting the mobile device management authority as Microsoft Intune and setting up MDM.
segment.target: If you haven’t already, prepare for mobile device management by setting the mobile device management authority as Microsoft Intune and setting up MDM.

segment.source: Get a certificate signing request
segment.target: Get a certificate signing request

segment.source: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Administration > Mobile Device Management > iOS and Mac OS X > Upload an APNs Certificate, and click Download the APNs certificate request.
segment.target: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Administration > Mobile Device Management > iOS and Mac OS X > Upload an APNs Certificate, and click Download the APNs certificate request.

segment.source: Save the certificate signing request (.csr) file locally.
segment.target: Save the certificate signing request (.csr) file locally.

segment.source: The .csr file is used to request a trust relationship certificate from the Apple Push Certificates Portal.
segment.target: The .csr file is used to request a trust relationship certificate from the Apple Push Certificates Portal.

segment.source: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate
segment.target: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate

segment.source: Go to the Apple Push Certificates Portal and sign in with your company Apple ID to create the APNs certificate using the .csr file.
segment.target: Go to the Apple Push Certificates Portal and sign in with your company Apple ID to create the APNs certificate using the .csr file.

segment.source: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your APNs certificate.
segment.target: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your APNs certificate.

segment.source: Download the APNs (.pem) certificate and save the file locally.
segment.target: Download the APNs (.pem) certificate and save the file locally.

segment.source: This APNs certificate file is used to establish a trust relationship between the Apple Push Notification server and Intune’s mobile device management authority.
segment.target: This APNs certificate file is used to establish a trust relationship between the Apple Push Notification server and Intune’s mobile device management authority.

segment.source: Add the APNs certificate to Intune
segment.target: Add the APNs certificate to Intune

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Administration > Mobile Device Management > iOS and Mac OS X > Upload an APNs Certificate, and click Upload the APNs certificate.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Administration > Mobile Device Management > iOS and Mac OS X > Upload an APNs Certificate, and click Upload the APNs certificate.

segment.source: Browse to the certificate (.pem) file and click Open and then enter your Apple ID.
segment.target: Browse to the certificate (.pem) file and click Open and then enter your Apple ID.

segment.source: With the APNs certificate, Intune can enroll and manage iOS devices by pushing policy to enrolled mobile devices.
segment.target: With the APNs certificate, Intune can enroll and manage iOS devices by pushing policy to enrolled mobile devices.

segment.source: Tell users how to get access to company resources with the company portal
segment.target: Tell users how to get access to company resources with the company portal

segment.source: Your users will need to know how to enroll their devices and what to expect once they're brought into management.
segment.target: Your users will need to know how to enroll their devices and what to expect once they're brought into management.

segment.source: What to tell your end users about using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: What to tell your end users about using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Corporate-owned device (COD) management with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Corporate-owned device (COD) management with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: As an alternative to enrollment with the Company Portal app, you can enroll corporate-owned devices purchased from Apple.
segment.target: As an alternative to enrollment with the Company Portal app, you can enroll corporate-owned devices purchased from Apple.

segment.source: Intune supports the enrollment of corporate-owned iOS devices using the Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) or the Apple Configurator tool running on a Mac computer.
segment.target: Intune supports the enrollment of corporate-owned iOS devices using the Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) or the Apple Configurator tool running on a Mac computer.

segment.source: You can enroll corporate-enrolled iOS devices in three ways:
segment.target: You can enroll corporate-enrolled iOS devices in three ways:

segment.source: Device Enrollment Program (DEP) device enrollment – Deploys an enrollment profile “over the air” that includes setup assistant options for the device.
segment.target: Device Enrollment Program (DEP) device enrollment – Deploys an enrollment profile “over the air” that includes setup assistant options for the device.

segment.source: Devices enrolled through DEP cannot be un-enrolled by users.
segment.target: Devices enrolled through DEP cannot be un-enrolled by users.

segment.source: Apple Configurator enrollment via Setup Assistant – Factory resets the device using Apple Configurator, enrolls the device, and prepares it with Setup Assistant options.
segment.target: Apple Configurator enrollment via Setup Assistant – Factory resets the device using Apple Configurator, enrolls the device, and prepares it with Setup Assistant options.

segment.source: Apple Configurator enrollment via Direct Enrollment – Creates an Apple Configurator-compliant file for use during device preparation via Apple Configurator.
segment.target: Apple Configurator enrollment via Direct Enrollment – Creates an Apple Configurator-compliant file for use during device preparation via Apple Configurator.

segment.source: The enrolled device isn’t factory reset.
segment.target: The enrolled device isn’t factory reset.

segment.source: This method only works if user affiliation is set to "No user affinity."
segment.target: This method only works if user affiliation is set to "No user affinity."

segment.source: Devices enrolled with these methods require the Intune Company Portal app to enable certain Intune capabilities such as Conditional Access and Mobile Application Management.
segment.target: Devices enrolled with these methods require the Intune Company Portal app to enable certain Intune capabilities such as Conditional Access and Mobile Application Management.

segment.source: Additional steps may be necessary to properly configure the Company Portal app.
segment.target: Additional steps may be necessary to properly configure the Company Portal app.

segment.source: Learn more
segment.target: Learn more

segment.source: Apple DEP enrollment for iOS device enrollment
segment.target: Apple DEP enrollment for iOS device enrollment

segment.source: To manage corporate-owned iOS devices with Apple’s Device Enrollment Program (DEP), your organization must join Apple DEP and acquire devices through that program.
segment.target: To manage corporate-owned iOS devices with Apple’s Device Enrollment Program (DEP), your organization must join Apple DEP and acquire devices through that program.

segment.source: Details of that process are available at: https://deploy.apple.com.
segment.target: Details of that process are available at: https://deploy.apple.com.

segment.source: Advantages of the program include hands-free set up devices without USB-connecting each device to a computer.
segment.target: Advantages of the program include hands-free set up devices without USB-connecting each device to a computer.

segment.source: Before you can enroll corporate-owned iOS devices with DEP, you need a DEP Token from Apple.
segment.target: Before you can enroll corporate-owned iOS devices with DEP, you need a DEP Token from Apple.

segment.source: This token allows Intune to sync information about DEP-participating devices owned by your corporation.
segment.target: This token allows Intune to sync information about DEP-participating devices owned by your corporation.

segment.source: It also permits Intune to perform Enrollment Profile uploads to Apple and to assign devices to those profiles.
segment.target: It also permits Intune to perform Enrollment Profile uploads to Apple and to assign devices to those profiles.

segment.source: Enable DEP management with Intune
segment.target: Enable DEP management with Intune

segment.source: Start managing iOS devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Start managing iOS devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Before you can enroll iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices, you must complete enable iOS management for Intune.
segment.target: Before you can enroll iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices, you must complete enable iOS management for Intune.

segment.source: Get an Encryption Key
segment.target: Get an Encryption Key

segment.source: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Download Encryption Key.
segment.target: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Download Encryption Key.

segment.source: Save the encryption key (.pem) file locally.
segment.target: Save the encryption key (.pem) file locally.

segment.source: The .pem file is used to request a trust-relationship certificate from the Apple Device Enrollment Program portal.
segment.target: The .pem file is used to request a trust-relationship certificate from the Apple Device Enrollment Program portal.

segment.source: Get a Device Enrollment Program token
segment.target: Get a Device Enrollment Program token

segment.source: Go to the Device Enrollment Program Portal (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.
segment.target: Go to the Device Enrollment Program Portal (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.

segment.source: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your DEP token.
segment.target: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your DEP token.

segment.source: In the Device Enrollment Program Portal portal, go Device Enrollment Program > Manage Servers, and then click Add MDM Server.
segment.target: In the Device Enrollment Program Portal portal, go Device Enrollment Program > Manage Servers, and then click Add MDM Server.

segment.source: Enter the MDM Server Name and then click Next.
segment.target: Enter the MDM Server Name and then click Next.

segment.source: The server name is for your reference to identify the MDM server.
segment.target: The server name is for your reference to identify the MDM server.

segment.source: It is not name or URL of the Microsoft Intune server.
segment.target: It is not name or URL of the Microsoft Intune server.

segment.source: The Add <ServerName> dialog box opens.
segment.target: The Add <ServerName> dialog box opens.

segment.source: Click Choose File…
segment.target: Click Choose File…

segment.source: to upload the .pem file and then click Next.
segment.target: to upload the .pem file and then click Next.

segment.source: The Add <ServerName> dialog box displays a Your Server Token link.
segment.target: The Add <ServerName> dialog box displays a Your Server Token link.

segment.source: Download the server token (.p7m) file to your computer, and then click Done.
segment.target: Download the server token (.p7m) file to your computer, and then click Done.

segment.source: This certificate (.p7m) file is used to establish a trust relationship between Intune and Apple’s Device Enrollment Program servers.
segment.target: This certificate (.p7m) file is used to establish a trust relationship between Intune and Apple’s Device Enrollment Program servers.

segment.source: Add the DEP token to Intune
segment.target: Add the DEP token to Intune

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Upload the DEP Token.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Upload the DEP Token.

segment.source: Browse to the certificate (.p7m) file, enter your Apple ID, and click Upload.
segment.target: Browse to the certificate (.p7m) file, enter your Apple ID, and click Upload.

segment.source: Setup Assistant enrollment for Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices
segment.target: Setup Assistant enrollment for Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices

segment.source: Add the Corporate Device Enrollment Policy
segment.target: Add the Corporate Device Enrollment Policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment and then click Add.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment and then click Add.

segment.source: Provide General details including Name and Description, specify whether devices assigned to the profile have user affinity or belong to a group, and then enable Configure Device Enrollment Program settings for this policy to support DEP.
segment.target: Provide General details including Name and Description, specify whether devices assigned to the profile have user affinity or belong to a group, and then enable Configure Device Enrollment Program settings for this policy to support DEP.

segment.source: The Setup assistant panes define the iOS device settings configured during setup.
segment.target: The Setup assistant panes define the iOS device settings configured during setup.

segment.source: Assign DEP Devices for Management
segment.target: Assign DEP Devices for Management

segment.source: Go to the Device Enrollment Program Portal (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.
segment.target: Go to the Device Enrollment Program Portal (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.

segment.source: Go Deployment Program > Device Enrollment Program > Manage Devices.
segment.target: Go Deployment Program > Device Enrollment Program > Manage Devices.

segment.source: Specify how you will Choose Devices, provide device information and specify details by device Serial Number, Order Number, or Upload CSV File.
segment.target: Specify how you will Choose Devices, provide device information and specify details by device Serial Number, Order Number, or Upload CSV File.

segment.source: Next, select Assign to Server and select the <ServerName> specified for Microsoft Intune, and then click OK.
segment.target: Next, select Assign to Server and select the <ServerName> specified for Microsoft Intune, and then click OK.

segment.source: Synchronize DEP-Managed Devices
segment.target: Synchronize DEP-Managed Devices

segment.source: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Sync now.
segment.target: As an administrative user, open the Microsoft Intune administration console, go to Admin > Mobile Device Management > iOS > Device Enrollment Program, and click Sync now.

segment.source: A sync request is sent to Apple.
segment.target: A sync request is sent to Apple.

segment.source: To see DEP-managed devices after synchronization, in the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Corporate-Owned Devices.
segment.target: To see DEP-managed devices after synchronization, in the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Corporate-Owned Devices.

segment.source: In the Corporate-owned Devices workspace, the State for managed devices reads “Not contacted” until the device is powered on and runs the Setup Assistant to enroll the device.
segment.target: In the Corporate-owned Devices workspace, the State for managed devices reads “Not contacted” until the device is powered on and runs the Setup Assistant to enroll the device.

segment.source: Distribute devices to users
segment.target: Distribute devices to users

segment.source: Your corporate-owned devices can now be distributed to users.
segment.target: Your corporate-owned devices can now be distributed to users.

segment.source: When an iOS device is turned on it will be enrolled for management by Intune.
segment.target: When an iOS device is turned on it will be enrolled for management by Intune.

segment.source: Apple Configurator enrollment via Setup Assistant for iOS devices
segment.target: Apple Configurator enrollment via Setup Assistant for iOS devices

segment.source: Using Apple Configurator you can factory reset iOS devices and prepares them for setup by the device’s new user.
segment.target: Using Apple Configurator you can factory reset iOS devices and prepares them for setup by the device’s new user.

segment.source: This method requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment and assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0.
segment.target: This method requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment and assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Physical access to iOS devices - Devices must be unconfigured (factory reset) without password protection
segment.target: Physical access to iOS devices - Devices must be unconfigured (factory reset) without password protection

segment.source: Device serial numbers - How to get an iOS serial number
segment.target: Device serial numbers - How to get an iOS serial number

segment.source: USB connection cables
segment.target: USB connection cables

segment.source: Mac computer with Apple Configurator 2.0
segment.target: Mac computer with Apple Configurator 2.0

segment.source: Enable Setup Assistant enrollment with Intune
segment.target: Enable Setup Assistant enrollment with Intune

segment.source: Create mobile device group (Optional)
segment.target: Create mobile device group (Optional)

segment.source: If your business requires mobile device groups to help manage devices, create those groups.
segment.target: If your business requires mobile device groups to help manage devices, create those groups.

segment.source: Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Create a profile for devices
segment.target: Create a profile for devices

segment.source: A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to a group of devices.
segment.target: A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to a group of devices.

segment.source: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.
segment.target: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.

segment.source: To create a profile
segment.target: To create a profile

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Owned Devices, and then click Add….
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Owned Devices, and then click Add….

segment.source: Enter details for the device profiles:
segment.target: Enter details for the device profiles:

segment.source: Name – Name of the device enrollment profile.
segment.target: Name – Name of the device enrollment profile.

segment.source: (Not visible to users)
segment.target: (Not visible to users)

segment.source: Description - Description of the device enrollment profile.
segment.target: Description - Description of the device enrollment profile.

segment.source: (Not visible to users)
segment.target: (Not visible to users)

segment.source: Enrollment Details – Specifies how devices are enrolled.
segment.target: Enrollment Details – Specifies how devices are enrolled.

segment.source: Prompt for user affinity – The iOS device can be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.
segment.target: Prompt for user affinity – The iOS device can be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.

segment.source: For most Setup Assistant scenarios, use Prompt for user affinity.
segment.target: For most Setup Assistant scenarios, use Prompt for user affinity.

segment.source: This mode supports a number of scenarios:
segment.target: This mode supports a number of scenarios:

segment.source: Corporate-owned personal device – “Choose Your Own Device” (CYOD) Similar to privately owned or personal devices but the administrator has certain privileges including permission to wipe, reset, administer, and unenroll the device.
segment.target: Corporate-owned personal device – “Choose Your Own Device” (CYOD) Similar to privately owned or personal devices but the administrator has certain privileges including permission to wipe, reset, administer, and unenroll the device.

segment.source: The device’s user can install apps and has most other permissions for device use where not blocked by management policy.
segment.target: The device’s user can install apps and has most other permissions for device use where not blocked by management policy.

segment.source: Device enrollment manager account – The device is enrolled using a special Intune administrator account.
segment.target: Device enrollment manager account – The device is enrolled using a special Intune administrator account.

segment.source: It can be managed as a private account, but only a user who knows the enrollment manager credentials can install apps, wipe, reset, administer, and unenroll the device.
segment.target: It can be managed as a private account, but only a user who knows the enrollment manager credentials can install apps, wipe, reset, administer, and unenroll the device.

segment.source: For information about enrolling a device shared by many users through a common account, see Enroll corporate-owned devices with the Device Enrollment Manager in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about enrolling a device shared by many users through a common account, see Enroll corporate-owned devices with the Device Enrollment Manager in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: No user affinity – The device is user-less.
segment.target: No user affinity – The device is user-less.

segment.source: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.
segment.target: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.

segment.source: Apps requiring user affiliation are disabled or won’t work.
segment.target: Apps requiring user affiliation are disabled or won’t work.

segment.source: Device group pre-assignment – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.
segment.target: Device group pre-assignment – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.

segment.source: You can reassign devices after enrollment.
segment.target: You can reassign devices after enrollment.

segment.source: Device Enrollment Program - The Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) settings cannot be used with Apple Configurator Setup Assistant enrollment.
segment.target: Device Enrollment Program - The Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) settings cannot be used with Apple Configurator Setup Assistant enrollment.

segment.source: Ensure the toggle is set to off.
segment.target: Ensure the toggle is set to off.

segment.source: Click Save Profile to add the profile.
segment.target: Click Save Profile to add the profile.

segment.source: Add iOS devices to enroll with Setup Assistant
segment.target: Add iOS devices to enroll with Setup Assistant

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > All Corporate-owned Devices > All Devices, and then click Add devices….
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > All Corporate-owned Devices > All Devices, and then click Add devices….

segment.source: You can add devices in two ways:
segment.target: You can add devices in two ways:

segment.source: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.
segment.target: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.

segment.source: <Serial #1>
segment.target: <Serial #1>

segment.source: <Device #1 Details>
segment.target: <Device #1 Details>

segment.source: <Serial#2>
segment.target: <Serial#2>

segment.source: <Device #2 Details>
segment.target: <Device #2 Details>

segment.source: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:
segment.target: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:

segment.source: Manually add device details - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices
segment.target: Manually add device details - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices

segment.source: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you might need to remove the device serial number from Intune in the Corporate-owned devices group to disable device enrollment.
segment.target: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you might need to remove the device serial number from Intune in the Corporate-owned devices group to disable device enrollment.

segment.source: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.
segment.target: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.

segment.source: And then click Next.
segment.target: And then click Next.

segment.source: Select devices to enroll
segment.target: Select devices to enroll

segment.source: Confirm the devices to enroll.
segment.target: Confirm the devices to enroll.

segment.source: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.
segment.target: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Assign profile
segment.target: Assign profile

segment.source: Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the Enrollment profile details, and then click Finish.
segment.target: Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the Enrollment profile details, and then click Finish.

segment.source: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.
segment.target: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.

segment.source: Export a profile to deploy to iOS devices
segment.target: Export a profile to deploy to iOS devices

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.

segment.source: Click Export…
segment.target: Click Export…

segment.source: in the taskbar.
segment.target: in the taskbar.

segment.source: Copy and save the 2.0 Profile URL.
segment.target: Copy and save the 2.0 Profile URL.

segment.source: You will upload it in Apple Configurator later to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.
segment.target: You will upload it in Apple Configurator later to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.

segment.source: To support Apple Configurator 2, the 2.0 Profile URL must be edited.
segment.target: To support Apple Configurator 2, the 2.0 Profile URL must be edited.

segment.source: Replace
segment.target: Replace

segment.source: with
segment.target: with

segment.source: You will upload this profile URL to the Apple DEP service using Apple Configurator in the following procedure to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.
segment.target: You will upload this profile URL to the Apple DEP service using Apple Configurator in the following procedure to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.

segment.source: The enrollment profile URL is valid for two weeks from when it is exported.
segment.target: The enrollment profile URL is valid for two weeks from when it is exported.

segment.source: After two weeks, you must export a new enrollment profile .mobileconfig file to enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant.
segment.target: After two weeks, you must export a new enrollment profile .mobileconfig file to enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant.

segment.source: Prepare the device with Apple Configurator
segment.target: Prepare the device with Apple Configurator

segment.source: iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.
segment.target: iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.

segment.source: On Mac computer, open Apple Configurator 2, and connect the iOS mobile devices to the Apple computer with a USB adapter.
segment.target: On Mac computer, open Apple Configurator 2, and connect the iOS mobile devices to the Apple computer with a USB adapter.

segment.source: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.
segment.target: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.

segment.source: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.
segment.target: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.

segment.source: As a best practice, devices should be at the Hello screen when you connect the device.
segment.target: As a best practice, devices should be at the Hello screen when you connect the device.

segment.source: Click Prepare.
segment.target: Click Prepare.

segment.source: On the Prepare iOS Device pane, select Manual and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Prepare iOS Device pane, select Manual and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Enroll in MDM Server pane, select New Server, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Enroll in MDM Server pane, select New Server, and then click Next.

segment.source: On Define an MDM Server pane, enter a Name, paste the 2.0 Profile URL, and then click Next.
segment.target: On Define an MDM Server pane, enter a Name, paste the 2.0 Profile URL, and then click Next.

segment.source: You do not need to modify anchor certificates.
segment.target: You do not need to modify anchor certificates.

segment.source: Click Next again.
segment.target: Click Next again.

segment.source: On the Supervise Devices pane, select the level of supervision, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Supervise Devices pane, select the level of supervision, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Create an Organization pane, choose the Organization or create a new organization, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Create an Organization pane, choose the Organization or create a new organization, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure iOS Setup Assistant pane, choose the steps presented to the user, and then click Prepare.
segment.target: On the Configure iOS Setup Assistant pane, choose the steps presented to the user, and then click Prepare.

segment.source: If prompted, authenticate to update trust settings.
segment.target: If prompted, authenticate to update trust settings.

segment.source: When the iOS device finishes preparing, you can disconnect the USB cable.
segment.target: When the iOS device finishes preparing, you can disconnect the USB cable.

segment.source: Distribute devices
segment.target: Distribute devices

segment.source: The devices are now ready for corporate enrollment.
segment.target: The devices are now ready for corporate enrollment.

segment.source: Power down the devices and distribute them to users.
segment.target: Power down the devices and distribute them to users.

segment.source: When the device is turned on, the Setup Assistant will start.
segment.target: When the device is turned on, the Setup Assistant will start.

segment.source: During device setup, the Setup Assistant prompts users to apply a configuration from IT.
segment.target: During device setup, the Setup Assistant prompts users to apply a configuration from IT.

segment.source: The end-user must accept this configuration to enroll.
segment.target: The end-user must accept this configuration to enroll.

segment.source: When distributing devices, include instructions for users to accept this configuration.
segment.target: When distributing devices, include instructions for users to accept this configuration.

segment.source: Apple Configurator enrollment via direct enrollment for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Apple Configurator enrollment via direct enrollment for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Using Apple Configurator you can enroll iOS devices for management without resetting them to factory settings.
segment.target: Using Apple Configurator you can enroll iOS devices for management without resetting them to factory settings.

segment.source: This method is for devices with No user affinity and requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment.
segment.target: This method is for devices with No user affinity and requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment.

segment.source: The Company Portal app is not supported for direct enrolled devices.
segment.target: The Company Portal app is not supported for direct enrolled devices.

segment.source: This guidance assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0 on a Mac computer.
segment.target: This guidance assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0 on a Mac computer.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Physical access to iOS devices
segment.target: Physical access to iOS devices

segment.source: Device serial numbers - How to get an iOS serial number
segment.target: Device serial numbers - How to get an iOS serial number

segment.source: USB connection cables
segment.target: USB connection cables

segment.source: Mac computer with Apple Configurator 2.0
segment.target: Mac computer with Apple Configurator 2.0

segment.source: Direct enrollment with Intune
segment.target: Direct enrollment with Intune

segment.source: Create a profile for devices
segment.target: Create a profile for devices

segment.source: A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to devices.
segment.target: A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to devices.

segment.source: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.
segment.target: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.

segment.source: To create a profile
segment.target: To create a profile

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then click Add….
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then click Add….

segment.source: Enter details for the device profiles:
segment.target: Enter details for the device profiles:

segment.source: Name – Name of the device enrollment profile.
segment.target: Name – Name of the device enrollment profile.

segment.source: Not visible to users.
segment.target: Not visible to users.

segment.source: Description - Description of the device enrollment profile.
segment.target: Description - Description of the device enrollment profile.

segment.source: Not visible to users.
segment.target: Not visible to users.

segment.source: User affiliation – Specifies how devices are enrolled.
segment.target: User affiliation – Specifies how devices are enrolled.

segment.source: For Direct Enrollment, select No user affinity.
segment.target: For Direct Enrollment, select No user affinity.

segment.source: Device group pre-assignment – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.
segment.target: Device group pre-assignment – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.

segment.source: You can reassign devices after enrollment.
segment.target: You can reassign devices after enrollment.

segment.source: Click Save Profile to add the profile.
segment.target: Click Save Profile to add the profile.

segment.source: Add iOS devices to enroll with Apple Configurator
segment.target: Add iOS devices to enroll with Apple Configurator

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > Corporate pre-enrolled devices > By iOS serial number, and then click Add devices….
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > Corporate pre-enrolled devices > By iOS serial number, and then click Add devices….

segment.source: You can add devices in two ways:
segment.target: You can add devices in two ways:

segment.source: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.
segment.target: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.

segment.source: <Serial #1>
segment.target: <Serial #1>

segment.source: <Device #1 Details>
segment.target: <Device #1 Details>

segment.source: <Serial#2>
segment.target: <Serial#2>

segment.source: <Device #2 Details>
segment.target: <Device #2 Details>

segment.source: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:
segment.target: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:

segment.source: Manually add device details - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices, and then click Next.
segment.target: Manually add device details - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices, and then click Next.

segment.source: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you must remove the device serial number from Intune in the Corporate-owned devices group to disable device enrollment.
segment.target: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you must remove the device serial number from Intune in the Corporate-owned devices group to disable device enrollment.

segment.source: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.
segment.target: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.

segment.source: Select devices to enroll
segment.target: Select devices to enroll

segment.source: Confirm the devices to enroll.
segment.target: Confirm the devices to enroll.

segment.source: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.
segment.target: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Assign profile
segment.target: Assign profile

segment.source: Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the Enrollment profile details, and then click Finish.
segment.target: Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the Enrollment profile details, and then click Finish.

segment.source: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.
segment.target: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.

segment.source: Select a profile to deploy to iOS devices
segment.target: Select a profile to deploy to iOS devices

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Policy > Corporate Device Enrollment, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.

segment.source: This profile should be the same profile that you assigned to deploy in the previous step.
segment.target: This profile should be the same profile that you assigned to deploy in the previous step.

segment.source: Click Export…
segment.target: Click Export…

segment.source: in the taskbar.
segment.target: in the taskbar.

segment.source: Click Download profile and save the downloaded .mobileconfig file.
segment.target: Click Download profile and save the downloaded .mobileconfig file.

segment.source: Transfer the file
segment.target: Transfer the file

segment.source: Copy the downloaded .mobileconfig file to a Mac computer.
segment.target: Copy the downloaded .mobileconfig file to a Mac computer.

segment.source: The enrollment profile .mobileconfig file is valid for two weeks from when it is exported.
segment.target: The enrollment profile .mobileconfig file is valid for two weeks from when it is exported.

segment.source: After two, you must export a new enrollment profile URL to enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant.
segment.target: After two, you must export a new enrollment profile URL to enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant.

segment.source: Prepare the device with Apple Configurator
segment.target: Prepare the device with Apple Configurator

segment.source: iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.
segment.target: iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.

segment.source: On a Mac computer, launch Apple Configurator 2.0.
segment.target: On a Mac computer, launch Apple Configurator 2.0.

segment.source: Connect the iOS device to the Mac computer with a USB cord.
segment.target: Connect the iOS device to the Mac computer with a USB cord.

segment.source: Close Photos, iTunes, and other apps that open for the device when the device is detected.
segment.target: Close Photos, iTunes, and other apps that open for the device when the device is detected.

segment.source: In Apple Configurator, single-click the connected iOS device, and then click the Add button.
segment.target: In Apple Configurator, single-click the connected iOS device, and then click the Add button.

segment.source: Options that can be added to the device appear in the drop-down list.
segment.target: Options that can be added to the device appear in the drop-down list.

segment.source: Click Profiles .
segment.target: Click Profiles .

segment.source: Use the file picker to select the .mobileconfig file you exported from Intune, and then click Add.
segment.target: Use the file picker to select the .mobileconfig file you exported from Intune, and then click Add.

segment.source: The profile is added to the device.
segment.target: The profile is added to the device.

segment.source: If the device is Unsupervised, the installation will require acceptance on the device.
segment.target: If the device is Unsupervised, the installation will require acceptance on the device.

segment.source: Install the profile
segment.target: Install the profile

segment.source: You are ready to install the profile on the iOS device.
segment.target: You are ready to install the profile on the iOS device.

segment.source: The device must have already completed the Setup Assistant and be ready to use.
segment.target: The device must have already completed the Setup Assistant and be ready to use.

segment.source: If enrollment entails app deployments, the device should have an Apple ID set up because the app deployments will require that you have an Apple ID signed in for the App Store.
segment.target: If enrollment entails app deployments, the device should have an Apple ID set up because the app deployments will require that you have an Apple ID signed in for the App Store.

segment.source: Completing profile acceptance for unsupervised iOS devices
segment.target: Completing profile acceptance for unsupervised iOS devices

segment.source: Unlock the iOS device.
segment.target: Unlock the iOS device.

segment.source: In the Install profile dialog for Management profile, tap Install.
segment.target: In the Install profile dialog for Management profile, tap Install.

segment.source: Provide Device Passcode or Apple ID, if required.
segment.target: Provide Device Passcode or Apple ID, if required.

segment.source: Accept the Warning, and tap Install.
segment.target: Accept the Warning, and tap Install.

segment.source: Accept the Remote Warning, and tap Trust.
segment.target: Accept the Remote Warning, and tap Trust.

segment.source: When the Profile Installed box confirms the profile has Installed, click Done.
segment.target: When the Profile Installed box confirms the profile has Installed, click Done.

segment.source: Verify profile
segment.target: Verify profile

segment.source: On the iOS device, launch Settings and go General > Device Management > Management Profile > and confirm the profile installation is listed, check the iOS policy restrictions, and installed apps.
segment.target: On the iOS device, launch Settings and go General > Device Management > Management Profile > and confirm the profile installation is listed, check the iOS policy restrictions, and installed apps.

segment.source: Policy restrictions and apps may take up to 10 minutes to appear on the device.
segment.target: Policy restrictions and apps may take up to 10 minutes to appear on the device.

segment.source: Distribute devices
segment.target: Distribute devices

segment.source: The iOS device is now enrolled with Intune and managed.
segment.target: The iOS device is now enrolled with Intune and managed.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune
